variant.question: An aircraft having sustained damage while on the territory of a Contracting State other than the State of Registry may fly without fare-paying passengers to an airport at which it can be restored to an airworthy condition if:

options.text: it receives permission of the State of Registry.
it receives permission from the Contracting State where the damage occurred.
it receives permission from the manufacturer of the aircraft.
the repair works may be done at an airport that is not more than 250 NM away.

variant.question: What is a State required to do regarding the aeroplane which has been unlawfully interfered with when it lands?

options.text: The contracting States will make provisions to ensure that an aircraft affected by an unlawful seizure act which has landed in their territory, would be detained on the ground, unless to do so would prejudice human life.
The ICAO Annex 17 does not recognize the need for consultations between the State where an aircraft affected by an unlawful interference act has landed and the aircraft operator's State.
The contracting States will not assist with the provision of navigation aids, air transit services, etc... to an aircraft affected by an unlawful seizure act.
The contracting States will make provisions to ensure that an aircraft affected by an unlawful seizure act which has landed in their territory, would be detained on the ground in all cases.

variant.question: When cargo, unaccompanied baggage or stores are not unladen at their intended destination but are unladen at another international airport, the Contracting State where the unloading takes place, if satisfied that there has been no gross negligence or carelessness by the operator:

options.text: shall not impose penalties, fines, customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties and fines but customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines and custom duties but taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines and taxes but custom duties on the operator.

variant.question: A State shall take adequate measures for the safety of passengers and crew of an aircraft which is subjected to an act of unlawful interference

options.text: until their journey can be continued.
and arrange for them to return to their country of origin.
during a period of investigation.
if is requested by an individual passenger.

variant.question: Security – Assistance to an aircraft following an act of unlawful seizure – A State shall provide assistance to an aircraft subjected to an act of unlawful seizure. This assistance shall include...

options.text: provision of navigation aids, air traffic services and permission to land.
provision of navigation aids, air traffic services, permission to land and refuelling.
permission to land and catering for passengers.
provision of navigation aids, air traffic services, permission to land and catering for passengers.

variant.question: Each Contracting State in which an aircraft subjected to an act of unlawful interference has landed shall notify by the most expeditious means the State of Registry of the aircraft and the State of the Operator of the landing and shall similarly transmit by the most expeditious means all other relevant information to:

options.text: the two above-mentioned States, each State whose citizens suffered fatalities or injuries, each State whose citizens were detained as hostages, each Contracting State whose citizens are known to be on board the aircraft, and the International Civil Aviation Organization.
the two above-mentioned States, each State whose citizens suffered fatalities or injuries, and the International Civil Aviation Organization.
the two above-mentioned States, and each State whose citizens suffered fatalities or injuries.
the two above-mentioned States, each Contracting State whose citizens are known to be on board the aircraft, and the International Civil Aviation Organization.

variant.question: Each Contracting State shall take appropriate measures for the safety of passengers and crew of an aircraft which is subjected to an act of unlawful interference, while on the ground in the territory of the Contracting State..

options.text: until their journey can be continued.
and must arrange for the passengers and crew to be returned to their country of origin.
during a period of investigation.
if this is requested by any individual passengers.

variant.question: Each Contracting State shall take appropriate measures for the safety of passengers and crew of an aircraft which is subjected to an act of unlawful interference, while on the ground in the territory of the Contracting State...

options.text: until their journey can be continued.
and must arrange for the passengers and crew to be returned to their country of origin.
during a period of investigation.
if this is requested by any individual passengers.
